subtitle: ={{$parameter["operation"] + ": " + $parameter["resource"]}}
description: Read, update and write data to Google Sheets

hints.message: Use the 'Minimise API Calls' option for greater efficiency if your sheet is uniformly formatted without gaps between columns or rows
No columns found in Google Sheet. All rows will be appended

options.name: Set Automatically
options.description: Automatically set based on resource and operation

options.name: Set Manually
options.description: Manually set the description

properties.name: toolDescription
properties.default: Read, update and write data to Google Sheets
properties.description: Explain to the LLM what this tool does, a good, specific description would allow LLMs to produce expected results much more often

options.name: Append or Update Row
options.description: Append a new row or update an existing one (upsert)
options.action: Append or update row in sheet

options.name: Append Row
options.description: Create a new row in a sheet

options.name: Clear
options.description: Delete all the contents or a part of a sheet

options.name: Create
options.description: Create a new sheet

options.name: Delete
options.description: Permanently delete a sheet

options.name: Delete Rows or Columns
options.description: Delete columns or rows from a sheet
options.action: Delete rows or columns from sheet

options.name: Get Row(s)
options.description: Retrieve one or more rows from a sheet

options.name: Update Row
options.description: Update an existing row in a sheet

properties.errorMessage: Not a valid Google Drive File URL
Not a valid Google Drive File ID

properties.name: dataMode

options.name: Auto-Map Input Data to Columns
options.description: Use when node input properties match destination column names

options.name: Map Each Column Below
options.description: Set the value for each destination column

options.name: Nothing
options.description: Do not send anything

properties.description: Whether to insert the input data this node receives in the new row

properties.displayName: In this mode, make sure the incoming data is named the same as the columns in your Sheet. (Use an 'Edit Fields' node before this node to change it if required.)
properties.name: autoMapNotice

values.name: fieldId
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

options.name: cellFormat
Let Google Sheets format
options.description: Cells are styled as if you typed the values into Google Sheets directly

options.name: Let n8n format
options.description: Cells have the same types as the input data
Determines how data should be interpreted

values.name: headerRow
values.description: Index of the row which contains the keys. Starts at 1. The incoming node data is matched to the keys for assignment. The matching is case sensitive.

options.name: handlingExtraData
Insert in New Column(s)
options.description: Create a new column for extra data

options.name: Ignore Them
options.description: Ignore extra data

options.name: Error
options.description: Throw an error
What do to with fields that don't match any columns in the Google Sheet

options.name: handlingExtraData
Insert in New Column(s)
options.description: Create a new column for extra data

options.name: Ignore Them
options.description: Ignore extra data

options.name: Error
options.description: Throw an error
What do to with fields that don't match any columns in the Google Sheet

options.name: useAppend
options.hint: Use if your sheet has no gaps between rows or columns
options.description: Whether to use append instead of update(default), this is more efficient but in some cases data might be misaligned

properties.name: startIndex
properties.description: The row number to delete from, The first row is 1

properties.name: range
properties.description: The table range to read from or to append data to. See the Google documentation for the details. If it contains multiple sheets it can also be added like this: "MySheet!A:F"

options.name: hidden
options.description: Whether the sheet is hidden in the UI, false if it's visible

options.name: rightToLeft
options.description: Whether the sheet is an RTL sheet instead of an LTR sheet

options.name: sheetId
options.description: The ID of the sheet. Must be non-negative. This field cannot be changed once set.

options.name: index
options.description: The index of the sheet within the spreadsheet

options.name: tabColor
options.description: The color of the tab in the UI

options.name: Rows
options.description: Rows to delete

options.name: Columns
options.description: Columns to delete

properties.name: startIndex
properties.description: The row number to delete from, The first row is 2

values.name: lookupColumn
values.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

values.name: lookupValue
values.hint: The column must have this value to be matched

properties.name: combineFilters
properties.description: How to combine the conditions defined in "Filters": AND requires all conditions to be true, OR requires at least one condition to be true

options.name: AND
options.description: Only rows that meet all the conditions are selected

options.name: OR
options.description: Rows that meet at least one condition are selected

properties.name: combineFilters
properties.description: How to combine the conditions defined in "Filters": AND requires all conditions to be true, OR requires at least one condition to be true

options.name: AND
options.description: Only rows that meet all the conditions are selected

options.name: OR
options.description: Rows that meet at least one condition are selected

options.name: Detect Automatically
options.description: Automatically detect the data range

options.name: Specify Range (A1 Notation)
options.description: Manually specify the data range

options.name: Specify Range (Rows)
options.description: Manually specify the data range

values.name: headerRow
values.description: Index is relative to the set 'Range', first row index is 1
values.hint: Index of the row which contains the column names

values.name: firstDataRow
values.description: Index is relative to the set 'Range', first row index is 1
values.hint: Index of first row which contains the actual data

values.name: range
values.description: The table range to read from or to append data to. See the Google documentation for the details.
values.hint: You can specify both the rows and the columns, e.g. C4:E7

values.name: general

options.name: Values (unformatted)
options.description: Numbers stay as numbers, but any currency signs or special formatting is lost

options.name: Values (formatted)
options.description: Numbers are turned to text, and displayed as in Google Sheets (e.g. with commas or currency signs)

values.description: Determines how values should be rendered in the output

options.name: Formatted Text
options.description: As displayed in Google Sheets, e.g. '01/01/2022'

options.name: Serial Number
options.description: A number representing the number of days since Dec 30, 1899

options.name: returnFirstMatch
options.description: Whether to select the first row of the sheet or the first matching row (if filters are set)

options.name: returnAllMatches
Return First Match
options.description: Return only the first match

options.name: Return All Matches
options.description: Return all values that match
By default only the first result gets returned, Set to "Return All Matches" to get multiple matches

options.name: Map Each Column Below
options.description: Set the value for each destination column

values.name: title
values.description: Title of the property to create

values.name: hidden
values.description: Whether the Sheet should be hidden in the UI

options.name: locale
options.description:
The locale of the spreadsheet in one of the following formats:
  • en (639-1)
  • fil (639-2 if no 639-1 format exists)
  • en_US (combination of ISO language an country)

options.name: autoRecalc
Default
options.description: Default value

options.name: On Change
options.description: Volatile functions are updated on every change

options.name: Minute
options.description: Volatile functions are updated on every change and every minute

options.name: Hour
options.description: Volatile functions are updated on every change and hourly
Cell recalculation interval options
